datascilib.Classifiers.RandomForest

Class RandomForest

  • java.lang.Object
    • datascilib.Classifiers.RandomForest.RandomForest

  • public class RandomForest
extends java.lang.Object

    Random Forest

    Random Forest is an enhanced version of Decision Tree that aims to reduce overfitting by averaging many weaker Decision Trees.

    Random Forest works by implementing many DescisionTreeEstimators defined by n_estimators that each fit on a randomized data set derived from the X and Y passed into the fit function. We first randomize which rows to fit on by taking a "bootstrap", which is the same dimensions as X, but is created by picking random rows from X with repeats. Next, the features that are considered are also randomized.

    When using predict(List), each DescisionTreeEstimator predicts the results and those predictions are averaged to create the final result.

    Since:
    2020-04-29

    • Method Detail

      • fit

        public void fit(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Double>> X,
                java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> Y)
        Fits a 2-D List of Doubles X and a 1-D List of Integers Y. Creates n_estimators number of DescisionTreeEstimators and fits a randomized bootstrap of the passed X to each. Checks of: empty lists, null values
        Parameters:
        X - is a 2-D List of Double points
        Y - is a 1-D List of Integer labels

      • predict

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> predict(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Double>> X)
        Predicts the labels for a 2-D List of Doubles X. Passed the X to each estimator and averages the results to create the final prediction, which is a 1-D List of Integer labels. Checks of: empty lists
        Parameters:
        X - is a 2-D List of Double points
        Returns:
        1-D List of Integer labels corresponding to X
